Who are you?

Passionate and motivated. Driven, with an entrepreneurial spirit and leadership qualities. Resourceful, innovative, forward thinking and committed. At Live Nation Entertainment, our people embrace these qualities, so if this sounds like you then please read on!


The Role:

Live Nation Entertainment’s Media & Sponsorship Division is seeking a Sponsorship Coordinator. Live Nation Media & Sponsorship architects, sells and manages the company’s national corporate sponsorship programs with the world’s most recognizable brands. It is an exciting, fast-paced team that collaborates with all facets of Live Nation’s business including venues, festivals, ticketing, artists, content, media (digital, social, mobile), promotions, and concert production. To learn more about our division, check out: https://livenationforbrands.com/.


Responsibilities:

  • Provide sales support to Director of Sales and aid in the sales pipeline by conducting market and brand research, prospecting, brainstorming inventory ideas and concepts, cold calling, etc.
  • Develop sales presentations and proposals for prospective clients with Director of Sales guidance.
  • Facilitate amphitheater, club, and theatre sponsorship asset requirements with applicable departments and divisions.
  • Oversee legal contract process, approvals, financial documents and budget management for local sponsors.  
  • Serve as a liaison between internal departments to ensure contractual fulfillment, proper project management pace, and the path to fulfillment.
  • Manage sponsor ticketing needs including order placement, tracking status, and client delivery.
  • Supervise coordination and execution of sponsorship activations during concerts including but not limited to brand displays, interactive consumer destinations, product sampling, signage, out-of-home advertising, hospitality events, promotions, social engagement, etc.
  • Assemble local recap presentations and provide supporting content for national recap composition.
  • Maintain program tracking tools and accurate information to manage sponsor business including budgets, AP/AR, inventory reports, amenity implementation, ticketing, CRM system, etc.
  • Manage local sponsorship interns using intern curriculum guidelines.


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree required plus a minimum 2 years relative business experience in sales, business development or client service.
  • Understanding of how sponsor specific goals factor into sponsorship business solutions, strategy, inventory selection, and package building process.
  • Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills with ability to keep detailed records.
  • Goal oriented and driven to achieve above average results.
  • Top notch customer service skills with commitment to excellence.
  • Stronger verbal and written communication skills.
  • Time management expert with a keen sense of daily task prioritization
  • Creative-thinking approach to customer success and internal operations.
